channel.title: Items on Open Science Escape Room

item.title: Sorry, try Again!
item.description: There’s nothing to see here 🤷, go back.

item.title: Coffee ☕️
item.description: Robin: Want a cup of coffee already, huh?

item.title: Epilogue
Google 💻
item.description: Just a kindly reminder that the use of Google to find answers to the questions is allowed, but it’ll be more of an achievement if you do it without 💪

item.title: Mouse 🐁
item.description: Dr. Springer: You found my lab mice!

item.title: Norge 🇳🇴
item.description: Det er den draumen me ber på at noko vedunderleg skal skje, at det må skje – at tidi skal opna seg, at hjarta skal opna seg, at dører skal opna seg, at berget skal opna seg, at kjeldor skal springa – at draumen skal opna seg, at me ei morgonstund skal glida inn på ein våg me ikkje har visst um. – Olav H. Hauge (1966) It’s the dream we carry in secret

item.title: THE ESCAPE ROOM IS CLOSED UNTIL 27/11 14.30 🔒
item.description: The escape room will open on Friday the 27th of November at 14.30 to avoid people peeking around and finding some of the clues before the interactive session starts!

item.title: This is the final clue
item.description: Robin: One of the superstars fighting against the monopoly of the large publishers, and literally breaking down pay-walls is the developer of the website SciHub. In order to unlock the door and “escape” the room, you need to collect three colors The flag of the country where the founder of SciHub originated from has the colors blue and … What is the color of the key in the SciHub logo?

item.title: Time 🕑
What are the benefits of Open Access?
item.description: Teachers, practicioners and anyone else without access to research through an institution can access and use research to improve their work Academics in developing countries can access research and stay up to date in their fields Public Access: Taxpayers feel they get value for their money Increased visibility of research More citations (due to more visibility) Compliant with funders (and the Research Excellence Framework) More transparency so academics can replicate and validate previous research When data is shared openly it can be used in other studies; reducing time and effort More accurate reporting from journalists to the public Open Access publications can help inform policy ❥ ▲ ◘

item.title: You found the secretest clue! 🔎
item.description: Dr. Springer: Do you think you should click the image below to get the clue?
Need to take a closer look, do ya?
Nothing to see here, move along…
